creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: drinking cup carved in the form of a nautilus shell
markings: maker\'S mark, city mark, underside of foot
provenance:
(…) Maximilian von Goldschmidt-Rothschild, Frankfurt am Main (until 1938, forced sale
November 11) [1]; City of Frankfurt am Main (1938–49, February 26, 1949, transferred to museum)[2]; Museum für Kunsthandwerk, Frankfurt am Main (1949; restitution to the heirs of Maximilian von Goldschmidt-Rothschild)[3]; heirs of Maximilian von Goldschmidt-Rothschild (from 1949). [Rosenberg and Stiebel, New York, until 1953; sold to Mia] [4]

[1] Copy of the contract of sale between M. von Goldschmidt-Rothschild and the City of Frankfurt of November 11, 1938, Institut für Stadtgeschichte Frankfurt am Main, Rechneiamt IV/2, fol. 29r-30r.

[2] G.R.668 as per taxation list (1938).

[3] H. Bräutigam acknowledges in a list all objects returned by the city (Lfd. Nr. 1-1443), Hessisches Hauptstaatsarchiv Wiesbaden, 1 Wik 7405/06, vol. II.

[4] MS.065 Rosenberg & Stiebel Archive. The Frick Collection/Frick Art Reference Library Archives.
title: Drinking cup
